alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Smith, southeastern Franklin and southwestern Webster Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to Gaylord. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Harlan around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Riverton and Inavale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
